Anthracnose.info: Fungal disease causing dark spots on leaves, stems, and fruit. Common in humid conditions.
Anthracnose.recommendations: Apply copper-based fungicides regularly, prune infected branches, improve air circulation.

Bacterial Canker.info: Bacterial disease causing necrotic lesions and cankers on stems and leaves.
Bacterial Canker.recommendations: Remove infected branches, sterilize pruning tools, apply copper bactericide.

Cutting Weevil.info: Pest that causes V-shaped cuts on leaf margins.
Cutting Weevil.recommendations: Use insecticidal sprays, remove heavily infested leaves, maintain plant vigor.

Die Back.info: Disease causing branch dieback, often due to environmental stress or fungal infection.
Die Back.recommendations: Prune dead branches, improve drainage, apply fungicides if fungal.

Gall Midge.info: Insect pest causing gall formations on leaves and panicles.
Gall Midge.recommendations: Remove infested plant parts, apply systemic insecticides during flowering.

Healthy.info: The leaf is healthy and shows no signs of disease or pest damage.
Healthy.recommendations: Continue regular monitoring and maintain good plant health practices. Ensure proper watering, nutrition, and pest management.

Powdery Mildew.info: Fungal disease causing white powdery coating on leaves and stems.
Powdery Mildew.recommendations: Apply sulfur-based fungicides, increase light exposure, reduce humidity.

Sooty Mould.info: Fungal disease appearing as black soot-like coating on leaves.
Sooty Mould.recommendations: Control honeydew-producing insects, apply fungicides, improve ventilation.
